column3: Hanuman enters the city of Lanka
Hanuman sees Pushpaka in Ravana's inner city
The inner buildings of Ravana's house
Hanuman starts to search in Ashoka garden
Hanuman's grief at the plight of Seetha
Seetha decides to give up life
Hanuman began to narrate story to Seetha
Seetha is shocked to see Hanuman
Hanuman reveals himself to be a messenger
Seetha asks Hanuman to describe the characteristics
Hanuman gives Seetha the signet ring sent by Rama
Seetha was both delighted and depressed
Hanuman asks Seetha to give him a token of remembrance
Hanuman consoles Seetha and travels northward
Hanuman thinks of destroying a sacred sanctuary of demons
Hanuman declares himself to be a messenger
Ravana orders Hanuman to be killed
Later Ravana orders to set fire to his tail
Hanuman makes up his mind to set fire to the city of Lanka
Hanuman doubts whether Seetha dies in the fire
Hanuman again visits Ashoka garden and sees Seetha
Hanuman leaps from Lanka and touches Mount Mainaka
Jambavan requests Hanuman to narrate clearly the happenings
Hanuman describes the plight of Seetha to his fellow monkeys
Dadhimukha reports Madhuvana destruction to Sugreeva
Hanuman apprises of the discovery of Seetha
Hanuman conveys Seetha's message to Sri Rama
Sri Rama urges Hanuman to repeat the words spoken by Seetha
Hanuman narrates an incident connected with a crow
Hanuman conveys to Rama that Seetha expressed a grave doubt
